p: Spring wheat ( Triticum aestivum L.) accounts for the largest cropping area (14.8%) in Canada and 96% of the total wheat is grown in the semiarid regions of Western Canada [ 22, 23]. Maize ( Zea mays L.) is one of the most important cereal crops in Central Canada (Ontario and Quebec), and about 90â€“94% of Canadian maize production occurs in these two provinces (Yang et al. 2013). Canada plays an important role in global food supply and any changes in wheat and maize production in Canada due to climate change will impact the global wheat and maize market [ 24, 25].
